author: S Vijay Kumar
text:
The CBI on Monday arrested S. Durga Prasad, Regional Commissioner (Chennai Region), Employees Provident Fund Organisation, two Enforcement Officers and four others in connection with a corruption case here.

Administrators of a Chennai-based educational trust, which runs a deemed university offering medical, dental and engineering courses, have also been cited as accused in the case.

According to sources in the agency, the CBI’s Anti-Corruption Branch received a specific input that Mr. Prasad had demanded Rs.25 lakh as bribe for favouring the educational institutions’ group in a case relating to subterfuge of wages paid to employees for the purpose of Provident Fund deduction/remittance.

On information that the bribe was paid, a special team intercepted an SUV in which Mr. Prasad and his friend Raja were travelling on Monday. A sum of Rs. 14.5 lakh, alleged to be part of the bribe, was seized from the vehicle. The money was handed over to the official by Sengottaiyan, Estate Officer-cum-Public Relations Officer of the institution. A conduit, Sudalaimuthu, who organised the deal took Rs. 50,000 as his commission and a part of that money was seized, the sources said. Besides Prasad, Raja, Enforcement Officers Ezhumalai and Manikandan, Sudalaimuthu, his manager Suryanarayanan and Sengottaiyan were arrested.
title: CBI arrests top PF officials on graft charges
